title: Deep Feed-Forward Neural Network for Bangla Isolated Speech Recognition
author: Dipayan Bhadra (Power Grid Company of Bangladesh Limited), Mehrab Hosain (Louisiana Tech University), Fatema Alam (Jahangirnagar University), ...
relevance_why: The implementation of a Deep Feed-Forward Neural Network and use of Mel Frequency Cepstral Coefficients could inform methodologies for audio processing and generative modeling, particularly in Bangla language applications.
background: Isolated speech recognition involves identifying distinct spoken words from recordings, which can be particularly challenging in non-English languages like Bangla.
contribution: This paper introduces a dataset and a 7-layer Deep Feed-Forward Neural Network to solve isolated speech recognition for Bangla, achieving a recognition accuracy of 93.42%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous Bangla speech recognition systems mostly utilized simpler models or focused on fewer classes with less robustness.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a deeper network architecture for a larger number of classes (60), showcasing improved performance through advanced feature extraction and compression methods.

key_innovation: The use of a 7-layer deep feed-forward architecture for isolated speech recognition in Bangla represents a significant advancement over prior research, which largely relied on shallower networks.
real_world_impact: The developed system can aid in creating more efficient Bangla language recognition applications, improving interactions in technology for millions of speakers.
limitations: The proposed system performs well in low-noise environments, but lacks robustness against noisy real-world conditions.

new_terms.Mel Frequency Cepstral Coefficient (MFCC: **Mel Frequency Cepstral Coefficient** is a representation of the short-term power spectrum of sound, commonly used in speech recognition due to its effectiveness in approximating human auditory perception.
new_terms.Deep Feed-Forward Neural Network (DFFNN): **Deep Feed-Forward Neural Network** refers to a multi-layered neural network where information flows in one direction—from input to output—without cycles, allowing for complex mapping between inputs and outputs.
